{"step_by_step_thinking": "Document [0] suggests that breast cancer prognosis might be inherited, as it found that daughters and sisters of a proband with poor prognosis had a 60% higher 5-year breast cancer mortality compared to those of a proband with good prognosis. Document [8] also supports this, stating that breast cancer prognosis clusters within families and suggests that the hereditary component is independent of patient and tumor characteristics and type of treatment. Document [1] and [2] also discuss the influence of genetic factors on the prognosis of breast cancer. Therefore, based on these documents, it can be concluded that breast cancer prognosis can be inherited.", "answer_choice": "A"}
